column4:
booking norm harder seen various airline sites fairly easy mix match class booking direction number never seen mixing (apart previously said award paid upgrade) two halves flight. saying possible suspect far easy
@simonpedal often (pre covid) flew business class manchester bangkok preferred early morning departure early morning arrival. idea picked chauffeur 05.00 dropped airport, quick check straight lounge (very good manchester well) hot shower followed leisurely breakfast perfect way start flight. certainly agree main business class lounge dubai best amazing variety excellent food. got used business days could face economy direction long haul
column5:
any booking out of the norm is harder but from what i have seen on the various airline sites is that it is fairly easy to mix and match class of booking in each direction with a number of them but never have i seen mixing (apart from as previously said award or paid upgrade) two halves of the flight. not saying it is not possible but i suspect far from easy
@simonpedal i often (pre covid) flew business class out of manchester to bangkok and preferred the early morning departure with the early morning arrival. for me the idea of being picked up by the chauffeur at 05.00 and being dropped off at the airport, quick check in and straight to lounge (very good one in manchester as well) a hot shower followed by a leisurely breakfast is the perfect way to start the flight. i certainly agree about the main business class lounge at dubai it has to be one of the best with an amazing variety of excellent food. i have got used to business and these days could not face economy in either direction long haul

(i subjective, average?) trouble stairs partner might, objects last leg experience, trip worth it? words, able see white domes scenery point driver drops area base stairs?

doi inthanon nat'l park - organized tour full-day trip. temple scenery look interesting, neither much interest nature hikes, waterfalls, etc., worthwhile? (admittedly, looked much info inthanon yet.)
day (tues): enjoy old city relax (if spent night lp return cm early/mid-afternoon, afternoon spent wandering cm last time).
day (wed): depart cm sukhothai driver bus, airport flight bangkok. time day next destination tbd. i'm sure could spend time chiang mai, three destinations explore, three weeks, fairly confident opportunity come thailand future. it!
thank much opinions advice!!!...ana
column5:
hi all and thanks in advance for answering questions and advice!
partner and i will be in chiang mai 3rd-8th december 2021, arriving from u.s. 10:30 am 12.3, leaving 12.8 tbd (possibility of extending to 12.9).
will be quite tired after long international flight, and partner gets jet-lagged easily. he is 61, i am 65, both in good health but i am more active than is he. we plan on spending most of our time in cm in old city area with day trips from cm to see 1-2-3 other places. would like to run my itinerary by you to get opinions:
day 1 (fri.): flight arrives cm 10:30 am, taxi into city, will store luggage at hotel (tbd in old city) and meander old city until allowed to check in officially. then will probably nap, relax at hotel, grab bite to eat, sleep
day 2 (sat): explore cm morning, take afternoon tour to doi suthep
day 3 (sun): spend the day walking city, seeing temples, other city sites, visit sunday night market (there is a sunday night market, yes?)
day 4 (mon): would like to take a day trip outside cm and this is where the bulk of my questions lie. following are the day trip choices being considered at this point and am open to other suggestions, considering i have already researched and discounted elephant trips, tribe village visits, and chiang rai golden circle trips.
wat prajomklao rachanusorn - according to google maps, it is 2.5 hr drive along route 118, 1252...how much time should we expect to be at the site? are the stairs (approx. 1km) very difficult (steep?), and about how long might they take to ascend? (i know this is subjective, but average?) i would have no trouble with the stairs but partner might, so if he objects to that last leg of the experience, is the trip worth it? in other words, will we be able to see the white domes and some scenery from the point where the driver drops us at the area at base of the stairs?
lampang - google maps says approx. 1.5 hr drive from cm via route 11. think we could also stop at lamphun along the way? lp looks like fun city to spend the day then head back to cm same day. yes? no?
since i would like to see both of the above places, what say you all to this idea?...get started early to leave cm to wat pr, spend morning there, then drive down to lampang, spend afternoon there and dinner, drive back to cm. basically, make it a long full-day loop. too ambitious? option is to spend night in lampang, next day tour city and head back to cm. if choice is one or the other (wat or lampang) for a day-trip, which would you choose and why? if we don't attempt the circle (cm, wat pr, lp, cm) and just do day trip to either place, would we be able to rent a car for the day, and are roads not too scary/complex the we could self drive?...or would it be easier to just take a tour (wat) or bus or train (lampang)?
doi inthanon nat'l park - would probably take an organized tour there as a full-day trip. temple and scenery look interesting, but neither of us has much interest in doing any of the nature hikes, waterfalls, etc., so would this be worthwhile? (admittedly, i have not looked at much info on inthanon yet.)
day 5 (tues): enjoy old city and relax (if we spent night before in lp we will return to cm early/mid-afternoon, so afternoon will be spent wandering cm one last time).
day 6 (wed): depart cm to sukhothai by driver or bus, or to airport for flight to bangkok. time of day and next destination tbd. i'm sure we could spend more time in chiang mai, but we have three other destinations we would like to explore, have only three weeks, and are fairly confident we will not have the opportunity to come back to thailand in the future. this is it!
thank you so much for your opinions and advice!!!...ana
column8: Chiang Mai itinerary and Day-Trip Questions

column4:
louby41 - phuket airport international airport destination many global airlines including number middle east based carriers. qatar emirates direct flights phuket approved "semi-commercial" flights (basically status allows landing rights current restrictions), see flights put operation soon phuket able open more.
as others mentioned, looking open jaw fare (man-bkk hkt-man) perhaps shorten travel time. search fares using multi-city option airline websites (don't look ways add together).
but searching based primarily layover times far advance basically waste time. schedules change times next april. hour layover now, could 55 minutes mad dash next april could longer layover.
column5:
louby41 - phuket airport is an international airport that is a destination for many global airlines including a number of the middle east based carriers. both qatar and emirates had direct flights to phuket approved as "semi-commercial" flights (basically a status that allows landing rights during the current restrictions), so we may see those flights actually put into operation as soon as phuket is able to open up more.
as others have mentioned, looking at an open jaw fare (man-bkk hkt-man) would perhaps shorten the travel time. you search for such fares by using the multi-city option on most airline websites (don't look up one ways and add them together).
but searching based primarily on layover times this far in advance is basically a waste of time. schedules can and will change a few times between now and next april. what is a 6 hour layover now, could be a 55 minutes mad dash next april or could be a longer layover.

column4:
understand correctly, asking exchanging money exit india returning home country, correct? true almost major international airport, exchange counters delhi airport check-in area past security exiting country. but, dollars, worth fee rate good.
i usually try estimate cash well last couple days trip, equivalent $10-20 leftover, usually rather spend inside airport nice meal food/snacks plane book gift something. spend airport returning said country, i'll exchange it. recommend cutting close estimation barely enough taxi airport...i've done before. :)
column5:
if i understand correctly, you're actually asking about exchanging money as you exit india and are returning to your home country, correct? as true with almost any major international airport, there are exchange counters in the delhi airport both in the check-in area and past security for when you're exiting the country. but, if its just a few dollars, it may not be worth it though as there is a fee and the rate is not as good.
i usually try to estimate my cash well the last couple of days of a trip, and then if its just the equivalent of $10-20 leftover, i usually would rather spend it inside the airport on a nice meal or food/snacks to take on the plane or even a book or gift or something. if it's more than i can spend in the airport though and i know i won't be returning to said country, then i'll exchange it. i wouldn't recommend cutting it so close though on your estimation that you barely have enough for the taxi to the airport...i've done that before. :)

column4: flight goes, presumably will, liable refund, credit flight change flight unless ticket purchased refundable/exchangable costs obligation so. best bet try claim travel insurance.
column5: if the flight goes, which presumably it will, you will not be liable for a refund, they may give you a credit for another flight or change the flight but unless the ticket you purchased was a refundable/exchangable one which costs more they are under no obligation to do so. your best bet i think would be to try and claim off your travel insurance.

column4:
>> 5/6 days <<
not long enough - affects practicalities.
day 1: arrive leh - acclimitisation; visit white peace pagoda
day 2: explore leh, including leh palace bazaars.
day 3: visit key villages monasteries located hemis thiksey; stok palace. return leh.
day 4: visit alchi, via likir, basgo ridzong monasteries lamayuru. return leh.
day 5: return flight del.
if additional days could include visit nubra valley visit diskit samstangling monasteries.
column5:
>> we have 5/6 days <<
not really long enough - this affects practicalities.
day 1: arrive leh - acclimitisation; visit the white peace pagoda
day 2: explore leh, including leh palace and the bazaars.
day 3: visit the key villages and monasteries located in hemis and thiksey; and stok palace. return to leh.
day 4: visit to alchi, via likir, basgo and ridzong monasteries and on to lamayuru. return to leh.
day 5: return flight to del.
if you have 2 additional days you could include a visit to the nubra valley and visit diskit and samstangling monasteries.

column4:
>> reach nainital delhi airport <<
many options.
by road - car bus.
by rail - two daily services kathgodam - early morning train departs ndls late evening train departs dli. see link:  kathagodam 30+ kilometres short nainital.
by air - arriving del convenient continue journey air. nearest airport nainital pantnagar (pgh). airport 70 kilometres nainital.
you could book connecting flight originating airport. currently flights pgh via ded. alliance air flight number: 9i 645
column5:
>> how to reach nainital from delhi airport <<
many options.
by road - by car or bus.
by rail - there are only two daily services to kathgodam - an early morning train which departs ndls or a late evening train which departs from dli. see link:  kathagodam is still some 30+ kilometres short of nainital.
by air - since you are arriving at del it will be more convenient to continue your journey by air. the nearest airport to nainital is pantnagar (pgh). the airport is about 70 kilometres from nainital.
you could book a connecting flight from your originating airport. currently flights to pgh go via ded. alliance air flight number: 9i 645
column8: How to reach Nainital from Delhi airport

column4:
i've never booked flight way air india carrier uk. i've booked separate tickets. fly direct goa heathrow air india certain days week?
when hopping via del bom allow 3hrs longer change terminals.
both delhi mumbai different terminals low cost airlines, e.g. spicejet, indigo etc. international carriers tend terminal, e.g air india, air asia. however, hard fast rule check carefully book.
changing terminals delhi fairly straight forward, shuttle bus. mumbai different, taxi. used shuttle bus order taxi drivers rip stopped way smile pay.
i flight booked del late december low cost airlines published prices waiting that.
column5:
i've never booked a flight all the way through as i think air india is the only carrier from the uk. i've always booked separate tickets. did you know you can now fly direct to goa from heathrow with air india on certain days of the week?
when hopping via del or bom i always allow about 3hrs and longer if you have to change terminals.
both delhi and mumbai have different terminals for most of the low cost airlines, e.g. spicejet, indigo etc. the international carriers tend to all go from the same terminal, e.g air india, air asia. however, there is no hard and fast rule so check carefully when you book.
changing terminals in delhi is fairly straight forward, by shuttle bus. mumbai is very different, you have to take a taxi. there used to be a shuttle bus but in order that taxi drivers can rip you off they stopped it and now the only way is to smile and pay.
i have my flight booked to del in late december but not all the low cost airlines have published prices yet so i am still waiting for that.

this is going to be a unique-ish post.
i run a monetized youtube channel that has over 17m views and 30k subscribers and i've made 10k from it so far.
60% of my viewers are from india, so for a while i was toying with the notion of doing an india trip and shooting vids for my channel there. and besides just my yt channel, from what i've researched india looks like the kind of place that would be incredible to backpack in--a great country for self discovery and spirituality (and also indian food is fire lol). call it 60% pleasure/40% business.
so, after being fully vaccinated, last week i pulled the trigger and bought a covid price $370 ticket from lax-india on 5/6
unfortunately, it's looking like the airline semi-scammed me, since they aren't issuing tourist visas at this time. it's good that i did research, or i very easily could have taken the 20 hour flight, and then been told at the airport i had to get the next trip back home!
now, i'm trying to get a business visa, but this is a big big big big long shot because yt is clearly not a typical business where u have a client in india or something like that and that's why you're visiting. is there something i'm missing here about being able to get a visa now?
also, if i can find a way to get there, it would be fantastic if i could find another backpacker to team up with for a bit.

column4: yes, flown business class uk bkk many times swiss, lufthansa austrian - good well priced cheapest fare bucket special offer. flying via european airport, wintertime, adds extra layer risk. post covid19 inclined look non stop flights - eva me. expensive yes, less risky less checking documents, less security checks, quicker journey time too.
column5: yes, i have flown business class from uk to bkk many times with swiss, lufthansa and austrian - all very good and well priced if you can get the cheapest fare bucket or a special offer. but flying via a european airport, especially in wintertime, adds an extra layer of risk. post covid19 i will be inclined to look at non stop flights - eva for me. more expensive yes, but less risky and less checking of documents, less security checks, quicker journey time too.

column5:

column4:
50 mins enough time depends airline airports. done going thru singapore. syd-sin-lhr.. flight generally fuel stop drop pick up. craft.
emirates syd-bkk-dxb-lhr. , 45 mins stop late bangkok asked passengers going dxb stay board . coming dxb-bkk-syd everyone come plane. requirement australian government.
i hour car trip late night arriving bkk.
time tell later year happen international travel. nothing wrong planning.

column5:
the 50 mins can be enough time it depends on the airline and the airports. i have done this going thru singapore. so it was syd-sin-lhr.. these flight are generally a fuel stop and drop off and pick up. you get back on the same craft.
emirates had one like this syd-bkk-dxb-lhr. , it was about 45 mins stop and if it was in late to bangkok they asked passengers going on the dxb to stay on board . coming back so the dxb-bkk-syd everyone had to come off the plane. this was a requirement of the australian government.
i would not like to have 3 hour car trip late at night after arriving at bkk.
time will tell later in the year what will happen with international travel. nothing wrong with planning.
chok dee

column4:
airline airport looking 50 minute layover? zurich swissair, fine. frankfurt, chance. depends.
you could rejig little bangkok end stay. private transfer kanchanaburi (hotel arrange book transfer oriental escapes) train station, airport flight surat thani (or other). night eh real pain, settling pack morning. find shattered night (not) sleeping train, sure much able enjoy eh stay. tired grumpy overnight train. could stay beach first, eh returning bangkok. elephant experience khao sok accomodation. (or khao lak many places, matter)
how about:
18,19,20 kanchanaburi
21,22. eh khao sok
23,24,25,26,27 phuket beach resort (have look khao lak, kamala)
28,29,30 bangkok
31 fly home.
if taking train way surat thani bangkok allow extra night this.
wherever end christmas, check advance see compulsory dinner charge day. avoids nasty shock!!
column5:
which airline and airport are you looking at for the 50 minute layover? if zurich with swissair, you will be fine. if frankfurt, no chance. so it depends.
you could rejig a little and do bangkok only at the end of your stay. either get private transfer from kanchanaburi (hotel will arrange or book transfer with oriental escapes) to the train station, or to the airport for flight to surat thani (or other). i think just one night at eh will be a real pain, settling in just to pack up again in the morning. you may also find that you are all shattered after a night of (not) sleeping on the train, so not sure how much you will be able to enjoy your eh stay. we are always tired and grumpy after the overnight train. you could also stay at the beach first, then do eh before returning to bangkok. you can do the elephant experience from any khao sok accomodation. (or from khao lak or many other places, for that matter)
how about:
18,19,20 kanchanaburi
21,22. eh or other khao sok
23,24,25,26,27 phuket or other beach resort (have a look at khao lak, or kamala)
28,29,30 bangkok
31 fly back home.
if taking the train one way between surat thani and bangkok allow an extra night for this.
wherever you end up at christmas, check in advance to see if they have a compulsory dinner charge for that day. avoids a nasty shock!!

column4:
#11 - schedule way busy kids tow. five stops (kanchanaburi, bangkok, beach, elephant hills, phuket) two weeks brutal, transfers alone eat much holiday time. pick two three stops enjoy holiday.
you consider spending time khao lak / khao sok area, beach time in, possible snorkeling trips, jungle visits, floating hotels lake, elephant hills tented camp within close proximity other. could fly bangkok via phuket airport.
column5:
#11 - your schedule is way too busy with kids in tow. five stops (kanchanaburi, bangkok, beach, elephant hills, phuket) in two weeks would be brutal, the transfers alone would eat up too much of your holiday time. i would pick two or three stops and enjoy your holiday.
you might consider spending time in khao lak / khao sok area, get your beach time in, possible snorkeling trips, jungle visits, floating hotels on a lake, elephant hills tented camp all within close proximity of each other. and you could fly to and from bangkok via phuket airport.

column4:
wise consumers commitments covid upheaval, wise businesses need stay flexible. possibility business could operational, simply want hassle future forced closures.
third-party "booking" sites "booking" agents dime dozen. but, true travel agent quite valuable.
my good friend, business traveler, travel agent handle needs. book transportation accommodations, secures visas fills particulars concerning places visited. and, case occasional bump road, resolves issues.
" can't ahead move holiday free charge."
there it!
column5:
just as wise consumers don't make commitments during all the covid upheaval, wise businesses need to stay flexible. there is a possibility that a business could still be operational, but simply don't want any hassle from future forced closures.
third-party "booking" sites and "booking" agents are a dime a dozen. but, a true travel agent can be quite valuable.
my good friend, a business traveler, has a travel agent handle all his needs. not only does she book transportation and accommodations, but she also secures visas and fills him in on any other particulars concerning the places visited. and, in the case of the occasional bump in the road, she resolves any issues.
" if it can't go ahead we can move the holiday free of charge."
there you have it!

you. helpful.
interestingly, aa website lists dfw airport "expedited check-in" verifly users. however, upon examination, primarily online/via app.
if upload required documents test results, "get verified status travel. check using app, mobile boarding pass streamline airport experience, international flights." hmm, sounds good, convinced.
will try verifly? yes. believe speed process? maybe, separate line check baggage, expedite reaches counter waited usual long line.
i glad hear quick tsa check. unfortunately, louisville, reports tsa lines taking two hours news week.
i open additional e-gates heathrow. standing crowded airport queues lengthy amounts time, assuming socially distance, increase risk covid .

column5:
thank you. that is helpful.
interestingly, the aa website lists dfw as an airport with "expedited check-in" for verifly users. however, upon further examination, this may primarily be online/via the app.
if you upload required documents and test results, you can "get verified status for travel. from there you can check in using the app, get your mobile boarding pass and streamline your airport experience, even for international flights." hmm, sounds good, but i am not convinced.
will i try verifly? yes. do i believe it will speed up the process? maybe, but if there is no separate line and you still have to check baggage, then it may only expedite things when one reaches the counter after having waited in the usual long line.
i am glad to hear you had a quick tsa check. unfortunately, here in louisville, reports of tsa lines taking one to two hours were on the news this week.
i do hope they open additional e-gates at heathrow. standing in crowded airport queues for lengthy amounts of time, and assuming some will not socially distance, would seem to increase the risk of covid .
after going through the required hoops for quarantine and testing, i almost hope for a call to prove i am doing what i am supposed to be doing.

column4:
tick "stay uk" asked arrival test reference number. need booked day day tests spending time uk going immigration uk.
if proper transit flight ticket day checked bags transferred airline, stay airside follow "transfer" signs.
i rung every day landed usa tuesday despite requesting text messages phone "silent" working.
fortunately, far, calls come zoom, teams cvp.
when asked this, told option text messages plf set that.
the callers enquired name year birth, asked address gave plf read various bits quarantining me. polite difficulty soft voiced man impenetrable accent. fault person hired certainly complain, fairly fraught 10 minutes.
i day test release test today results guaranteed midnight tonight.
i told results automatically test trace people rung day 8, need day test.
edited: 4:03 pm, july 18,
column5:
if you don't tick "stay in the uk" you shouldn't be asked for your arrival test reference number. you only need to have booked the day 2 and day 8 tests if you are spending time in the uk and are going through immigration in the uk.
if you are on a proper transit flight on a through ticket on the same day with any checked bags being transferred by the airline, you will just stay airside and follow the "transfer" signs.
i have been rung every day since i landed from the usa on tuesday despite requesting text messages because my phone has to be on "silent" when i am working.
fortunately, so far, the calls have come when i am not on zoom, teams or cvp.
when i asked about this, i was told that the option of text messages should not have been on the plf because they were not set up for that.
the callers have enquired about my name and year of birth, asked if i am at the address i gave on the plf and have read various bits about quarantining to me. they have been very polite and the only difficulty was with a soft voiced man with an impenetrable accent. the fault wasn't his but that of the person who hired him so i certainly didn't complain, but it was a fairly fraught 10 minutes.
i had my day 5 test to release test today with the results guaranteed by midnight tonight.
i was told the results would go automatically to the test and trace people and that i would only be rung on day 8, when i would also need to take my day 8 test.
edited: 4:03 pm, july 18, 2021

column4:
pcr test leave uk wren healthcare sent lovely courier deliver test lab.
they terrific gave results earlier promised. cost line companies.
for day 2, day pcr tests used biogroup's hampstead test centre; number centres london post rest england.
i due travel work day (working remotely several days) going test centre made sense. had, course, test usa shortly flew home london.
susan sf used biogroup, open hampstead fairly easy live near northern line station.
the day & day test package £150. test release day test £135 wanted results midnight day. next day £75.
column5:
i did the pcr test to leave the uk with wren healthcare who sent a lovely courier to deliver and take the test to the lab.
they were terrific and gave the results earlier than they promised. their cost was in line with the other companies.
for my day 2, 8 and day 5 pcr tests i used the biogroup's hampstead test centre; they also have a number of other centres around london and will post to the rest of england.
i was due to travel for work on day 6 (working remotely on several of the other days) and going to a test centre made sense. i had, of course, had a test in the usa shortly before i flew home to london.
susan sf had used biogroup, they are open to 8 pm and hampstead is fairly easy for me to get to as i live near a northern line station.
the day 2 & day 8 test package was £150. the test to release day 5 test was £135 because i wanted the results before midnight on the same day. next day would have been £75.

column4:
time research places ease inverness - depending interests you, many lovely/character-laden/historic places (that loch ness - suckered either!) excellent choices places stay eat me, basing dull, largely modern cityanything hours away little way scenery immediate area no-brainer.
its wrong fly-in/start though. inverness airport currently exempt air passenger duty, flights connecting rather competitively priced. work way south edinburgh glasgow departure.
edited: 4:17 pm, june 30,
column5:
use the time to a bit more research on the places you can get to with ease from inverness - depending on what interests you, there are so many absolutely lovely/character-laden/historic places (that are not loch ness - don't get suckered there either!) with excellent choices for places to stay and eat that to me, basing yourself in a dull, largely modern cityanything up to a few hours away with little by way of scenery in its immediate area is a bit of a no-brainer.
its not wrong to fly-in/start there though. inverness airport is currently exempt from air passenger duty, so flights connecting into it can be rather competitively priced. you can then work your way south to edinburgh or glasgow for your departure.
edited: 4:17 pm, june 30, 2021

column4:
exactly ms sturgeon said but, joking aside, sensible approach here. rather lockdowns freedom, can't advise people common sense? understand official line i'd planned meet friend leeds manchester lunch ahead. thinking day shopping, chester instead. i'd arranged visit someone nice day, stay garden to. see lot rampaging football fans, difference behave. millions people similar fall right side knife edge moment.
for op, means ahead perfectly safe reasonable plans made. booking today, flying edinburgh.
column5:
i don't know exactly what ms sturgeon has said but, joking aside, i like to think there is a sensible approach here. rather then having lockdowns or freedom, can't you advise people to use common sense? as i understand it the official line for me is if i'd planned to meet a friend from leeds in manchester for lunch then go ahead. if i was just thinking of a day out shopping, maybe go to chester instead. if i'd arranged to visit someone and it's a nice day, maybe stay in the garden even though you don't have to. if you see a lot of rampaging football fans, that doesn't make any difference to how you should behave. and if millions of people do similar things we fall the right side of the knife edge we seem to be on at the moment.
for the op, that means go ahead with the perfectly safe and reasonable plans you have made. but if you were booking it today, maybe think of flying to and from edinburgh.

column5:
hello, i've read everything the british government has published regarding rules, and have emailed them twice, only to receive a bureaucratic, nearly automatic response that doesn't answer my questions. i hope someone here can.
i am traveling from the usa to poland, (currently in the amber list) but going through london (lhr) in transit/layover, then returning same way a week later. i am fully vaccinated and will have covid test as required.
i am hoping i can get out the airport and head to a different airport to take my next flight, all within few hours, because that is significantly cheaper and the layover is cut in nearly half. i think they call this a "landslide" transiting. according to the british government website, one can "pass the uk border control but go back through it within 24 hours..." but the website doesn't specify if i can actually leave the airport and transit through the city to get to another airport....
is this possible?
thx

column5:
will the govt pay heed to this request? this could solve your problem
the andaman association of tour operators has called upon the secretary tourism, a&n administration to extend the time frame of rt-pcr test for the incoming passengers from the present 48 hours to 72 hours.
in a letter the secretary tourism, the president aato, shri m vinod that currently, the time limit for rt-pcr test before coming to the islands is within 48 hrs before the departure time for the flight to port blair. it is our humble request that the same may be increased to within 72 hours before the departure time for two prime reasons:
this will hand sufficient time frame to passengers coming via connecting flights from cities not directly connected to port blair via air. it would also augment the influx of tourists to the islands, which is the need of the hour.

i highly appreciate guidance above!
column5:
i will be traveling chicago to delhi to kochi (my first trip to india during pandemic) and was looking for some advice / answers. i am a u.s. citizen with oci card and while i come to delhi all the time but this will be my first time transiting on to another city instead of staying in delhi.
i will be flying united to delhi and land around 8pm; then will take air india next day at 11am to kochi. the ticket will be under same pnr issued by united.
- i understand that i will be clearing immigration and customs at delhi. after that do i just drop off the bags at the transfer desk / ai counter even though the next flight is several hours later? do they keep the luggage for that long?
- i am in double mind whether to stay at holiday inn airport hotel for few hours or should i (if i am allowed to) go out and stay at the radisson. are there any pros and cons of either?
- if i am able and decide to stay at an off-airport hotel, could i take one of the checked in luggage with me? by the way, will this mean that i might have ot take a covid test again before boarding flight to kochi?
i will highly appreciate any guidance with any of the above!

column4:
//if checked-in bags (say 3) stay off-airport hotel, check-in fewer bags (say 2) air india flight kochi?//
though never tried/needed problem,as decreasing weight/number increasing,only issue fresh baggage tag.
//the reason asked whether covid test stay off-airport - airport next morning check-in ai counter bags, consider domestic passenger (including covid test) passenger traveling domestically?//
last (month) visited kerala rules covid test,only register jagratha portal someone visiting short trip days,if longer rule quarentine test.i nights test quarentine.
as indian exiting delhi airport 1st start using aadhar card identify need , showing passport recent arrival stamp good idea anywhere.later saw tn kerala check self declaration form need fill question whether visited foreign country recent days arrived overseas last days, days needed write lie(for tn sure little doubt kerala)
as non indian passport can't hide arrival chance visit(and anything rule),you check kerala rules specifically,may kerala forum.as per goi rule clearing immigration custom delhi free move applies rules particular state.
.after arriving india travelled states,took domestic flights every state rules regulations,lots confusion ground.
edited: 2:11 pm, march 11,
column5:
//if i take all the checked-in bags (say 3) and stay at an off-airport hotel, can i check-in fewer bags (say 2) with air india on my flight to kochi?//
though never tried/needed but this shouldn't be a problem,as you are decreasing the weight/number not increasing,only they may have to issue fresh baggage tag.
//the reason i asked whether i will have to take another covid test if i stay off-airport - when i get back to airport next morning to check-in at ai counter for bags, will they consider me a domestic passenger and ask for things (including for covid test) as they would any other passenger traveling domestically?//
last (month) when i visited kerala there were no rules for covid test,only have to register at jagratha portal if someone in visiting for short trip up to 7 days,if longer then there was rule for quarentine and test.i was there for only 3 nights so no test and quarentine.
as i am indian so after exiting delhi airport 1st thing what we did was to start using aadhar card for any identify need , showing passport with recent arrival stamp was not a good idea anywhere.later i saw that in both tn and kerala before check in a self declaration form need to be fill with a question whether i visited any foreign country in recent days or arrived from overseas in last 7 days, though it was already more than 7 days so didn't needed to write a lie(for tn i m sure but little doubt about kerala)
as you are having non indian passport so you can't hide your arrival by any chance during your visit(and i won't suggest anyone to do or do anything against the rule),you should check kerala rules specifically,may ask in kerala forum.as per goi rule after clearing immigration and custom at delhi you are free to move but then applies rules of particular state.
.after arriving india i had already travelled between 7 states,took 9 domestic flights and every state have own rules and regulations,lots of confusion on the ground.
edited: 2:11 pm, march 11, 2021

column4:
there,
i'm early 30s traveling two others (moderate budget), trying feel whether itinerary ambitious. week side 1-week destination wedding galle, sri lanka (total approx 20 days). proposed itinerary, open suggestions stay (kerala houseboat, etc)/edits trip enjoyable tolerable:
(day 1-2)
cheap, quick (1hr) flight bangalore madurai, see tamil temples (good reference experiencing sri lanka tamil vibes later), chill shop day two.
(day 3-4)
3.5hr private car transfer madurai thekaddy/periyar np spice plantation exploration/bamboo rafting (these place 7mi apart, spend two days here).
(day 5-6)
3.5hr private car transfer alleppey jump houseboat chill canals arabian sea couple days.
(day 7)
1hr private transfer kochi, cool historical city offering flights bangalore (i think!) flight colombo (sri lanka) wedding start.
(day 8-14)
once fly colombo, initial west coastal travel (negombo galle) occurs 27th 2nd (as part wedding). transfer wedding guests takes hours via private bus.
(day 15-16)
post-wedding, leave galle explore tissa area (yala safari park w/ leopards elephants, etc. 3.5hr private transfer) two days.
(day 17-19)
from there, transfer (anywhere 2-5 hours, depending city/ies choose) central sri lanka kandy/ella/nuriwaya eliya area three days.
(day 20)
then transfer (~3-4 hours depending start point) colombo/flight bangalore/flight home.
looking forward hearing thoughts. curious covid could cause issues along way well.
thanks advance help!
b
column5:
hi there,
i'm early 30s traveling with two others (moderate budget), just trying to get a feel for whether this itinerary is too ambitious. we have a week on either side of a 1-week destination wedding in galle, sri lanka (total approx 20 days). here is my proposed itinerary, very open to suggestions of where to stay (kerala houseboat, etc)/edits to make the trip more enjoyable and tolerable:
(day 1-2)
cheap, quick (1hr) flight from bangalore to madurai, see some tamil temples (good reference for experiencing sri lanka tamil vibes later), chill and shop for a day or two.
(day 3-4)
3.5hr private car transfer from madurai to thekaddy/periyar np for spice plantation exploration/bamboo rafting (these are the same place 7mi apart, so would spend two days here).
(day 5-6)
3.5hr private car transfer to alleppey where we would jump on a houseboat and chill on the canals of the arabian sea for a couple days.
(day 7)
1hr private transfer to kochi, a cool historical city offering flights back to bangalore which we have to go through anyway (i think!) to get a flight to colombo (sri lanka) where wedding would start.
(day 8-14)
once we fly into colombo, the initial west coastal travel (negombo to galle) occurs during the 27th to 2nd (as part of the wedding). the transfer would be with wedding guests and takes about 3 hours via private bus.
(day 15-16)
post-wedding, leave from galle to explore the tissa area (yala safari park w/ leopards and elephants, etc. with a 3.5hr private transfer) for two days.
(day 17-19)
from there, we transfer (anywhere from 2-5 hours, depending on which city/ies we choose) to central sri lanka which is kandy/ella/nuriwaya eliya area for three days.
(day 20)
then transfer (~3-4 hours depending on start point) to colombo/flight to bangalore/flight home.
looking forward to hearing your thoughts. also curious if you think covid could cause some issues along the way as well.
thanks in advance for your help!
b
column8: South India & Sri Lanka trip Nov/Dec 2021

column4:
>> open suggestions <<
can dish tough love first?
>> light bangalore madurai, ... chill shop day two. <<
so, staying blr, fly there. secondly madurai visit list primarily meenakshi temple [spoiler alert - foreigner allowed view meenakshi]. madurai shopping note, plan leave hotel grounds, place "chill". nyet.
>> transfer kochi, cool historical city <<
kochi ordinary industrial indian city. nothing nice all. nyet.
fort cochin hand, well worth couple days.
>> flights bangalore (i think!) <<
nah. assuming normality, direct flights cmb cok.
so - reshape plan?
fly cok, transfer immediately fort cochin. couple days fort cochin.
drive chertala - stay  drive murinjapuzha stay  couple days either
drive alleppey two nights board houseboat -  
disembark travel cok flight cmb.
edited: 6:33 am, february 05,
column5:
>> very open to suggestions <<
can i dish out the tough love first?
>> light from bangalore to madurai, ... chill and shop for a day or two. <<
so, if you're not staying in blr, don't fly into there. secondly madurai is on the visit list primarily for the meenakshi temple [spoiler alert - if you are a foreigner you won't be allowed to view meenakshi]. madurai has no shopping of note, and if you plan to leave your hotel grounds, it is not place to "chill". nyet.
>> transfer to kochi, a cool historical city <<
kochi is a very ordinary industrial indian city. nothing nice about it at all. nyet.
fort cochin on the other hand, is well worth a couple of days.
>> flights back to bangalore which we have to go through anyway (i think!) <<
nah. assuming normality, you can get direct flights to cmb from cok.
so - how to reshape your plan?
fly into cok, transfer immediately to fort cochin. a couple of days in fort cochin.
drive to chertala - stay at  or drive to murinjapuzha and stay at  a couple of days at either
drive to alleppey for two nights on board your houseboat - either  or 
disembark and travel to cok for your flight to cmb.
edited: 6:33 am, february 05, 2021
column8: South India & Sri Lanka trip Nov/Dec 2021

column5:

day 1
we will land gau at around 12:45 and after standard clearing at airport, expecting to be out from airport at around 14:15. if so, we may reach city at around 16:00 and after hotel check in and fresh, we can take cab to kamakhya and try to reach there at around 18:00.
now our main concern is, if we can purchase that special darshan ticket of nrs.500/- in day 1 evening for day 2 morning darshan, we can book the afternoon flight from gau to del, as we believe we can finish the darshan lately by 09:30 on day 2 with that special entrance.
alternatively, on day2 morning, we can reach temple as early as 05:00 and stand on queue for purchasing special entrance ticket, however before hand we just need to be sure on everything that it works the same way we thought.

column4: goibibo fraudulent company interacted far travel experience. booked ticket thru goibibo fly air india bengaluru sanfrancisco feb'2020 flying april'20. due covid-19 international flights air india cancelled march'25th. considering situation approached goibibo umpteen times cancel refund amount paid air ticket. bothered respond emails calls date. helpdesk chat services use. sent email group chairman makemytrip oversees operations goibibo. response too. year fate refund amount unknown.a legal notice sent goibibo seeking refund. bothered respond either. plan issue national consumer forum help out. urge service goibibo. looks fly night operating company business ethics. learnt lessons hard way interaction. looks goibibo made money nation wide lockdown last year sitting pretty cash. moral story never book travel plans online portal goibibo. beware company. interacting goibibo carry high risk.
column5: goibibo is one of the most fraudulent company that i have interacted so far in my travel experience. i booked a ticket thru goibibo to fly on air india from bengaluru to sanfrancisco in feb'2020 for flying in april'20. due to covid-19 all international flights of air india were cancelled from march'25th. considering the situation i approached goibibo umpteen times to cancel and refund amount paid for the air ticket. no one has bothered to respond to either my emails or calls as of date. the helpdesk and chat services are of no use. i sent a email to the group chairman of makemytrip who also oversees operations of goibibo. there has been no response from him too. it is one year and fate of my refund amount is unknown.a legal notice has been sent to goibibo seeking refund. they have not bothered to respond to this either. i plan to take the issue to national consumer forum to help me out. i urge all not to use the service of goibibo. looks like they are a fly by night operating company with no business ethics. i have learnt lessons the hard way with this interaction. looks like goibibo have made their money during nation wide lockdown last year and sitting pretty on cash. moral of the story never book your travel plans with a online portal like goibibo. beware of this company. interacting with goibibo would carry a very high risk.
column8: Who else got cheated by Goibibo?

column5: i know i am asking about 2 very different places, but my family will be in india for about 10 days next spring (assuming we can enter) and we have new delhi, jaipur, and agra on the itinerary, and i think we have time for at least one more place. we are deciding between ranthambore national park (because we have 12 year old that loves animals and would love to see a tiger) and varanasi (which everyone tells us we have to visit). we can drive to the national park and fly out of jaipur, or we can buy a one way ticket to varanasi from delhi, and then fly home from there. cost will be about the same either way. we just need to know if anyone has a strong preference for one over the other? thanks very much for any help you can give

column4:
>> april <<
problematic, weather-wise, depending used to. summer india, northern plains - is, agra, delhi jaipur - expect maximum temperatures regularly high 30s c. varanasi, anything, slightly hotter april.
>> 16-17 days <<
my rough rule thumb nights everywhere. planning understand land transport india desperately slow. travelling overnight train adds layer efficiency - leave city wake next destination. circumstances consider travelling car+driver inter-city night. flights clearly faster, short haul flights india offer benefit factor long time consuming identity security checks, traffic airport end.
essentially options making bookings whilst outside country. need book advance.
irctc:  gold standard railways bookings. need create account.
 carry trains, charges premium ticket price.
appoint agent - 
to understand classes india train, read here: 
take look guides registering irctc.
on indiamike:

or seat61

or irctc
column5:
>> all in april <<
problematic, weather-wise, depending on what you are used to. this is summer in india, on the northern plains - that is, agra, delhi and jaipur - you should expect maximum temperatures regularly in the very high 30s c. varanasi, if anything, is slightly hotter in april.
>> that should give us 16-17 days <<
my rough rule of thumb is 3 nights everywhere. in planning you should understand that land transport in india is desperately slow. travelling overnight by train adds a layer of efficiency - leave one city and wake up in your next destination. under no circumstances should you consider travelling by car+driver inter-city at night. flights are clearly faster, however the short haul flights in india don't offer the benefit when you factor in the long and time consuming identity and security checks, and the traffic to get to and from the airport at either end.
essentially you have 3 options for making the bookings whilst outside of the country. and you will need to book in advance.
irctc:  this is the gold standard for railways bookings. you need to create an account.
 does not carry all trains, and charges a premium on the ticket price.
appoint an agent - 
to understand the classes in the india train, read here: 
take a look at the guides for registering with the irctc.
on indiamike:

or seat61

or the irctc

column5:
we'll be flying from dxb to mle on ek658 in october in first class. our plan is to check in to the flight in the early evening, around 6pm, head to the first class lounge for dinner and a few drinks and then stay in the transit hotel overnight until our departure at 4:30am.
did some initial research a couple months ago and thought this was ok, but just noticed a notice on the dxb airport website saying you can not check in earlier than 4 hours before your flight.
i tweeted to emirate's support on twitter and this was their response: "with the early check-in facility, you can check-in as early as 24 hours before your scheduled time of departure at our first class counter. thanks."
anyone have experience with a similar early check in recently and can let me know if we'll be able to keep our plans? i'm assuming the info on the dxb airport page could be outdated?

column4:
according cathay pacific, maximum transit time flights 24 hours. cathay pacific list transit requirements restrictions found here: 
of interest (at least me), transit hk flight coming mainland china, cannot transit hk flight going mainland china. cathay pacific sell ticket (specifically lax) guangzhou, transit hk, knowing current restrictions allowed board flight, betting restriction lifted flight.
column5:
according to cathay pacific, the maximum transit time between flights is 24 hours. the cathay pacific list of transit requirements and restrictions can be found here: 
of interest (at least to me), you can transit in hk from a flight coming from mainland china, but you cannot transit in hk to a flight going to mainland china. yet cathay pacific will sell you a ticket from the us (specifically lax) to guangzhou, with a transit in hk, while knowing with the current restrictions you will not be allowed to board this flight, so you're betting on the restriction being lifted before your flight.

column4:
moses - giveaway says 'operated by', means airline provides plane, crew etc. often multiple flight numbers actual flight, codeshares partners, case, qatar sold ticket qatar flight code ba plane.
on availability cost side things, noticed lot availability flight pairings price, 310 seemed average, august months. tickets available platforms eg. google flights (imo) book direct reasons - easier communicate with, less hassle, benefits loyalty program etc.
hope helps
column5:
moses - the giveaway is when it says 'operated by', that means it will be that airline that provides the plane, crew etc. there are often multiple flight numbers for the same actual flight, these are codeshares or partners, so in that case, qatar has sold a ticket with a qatar flight code but it's actually a ba plane.
on the availability and cost side of things, i noticed there was a lot of availability for flight pairings around the same price, 310 seemed to be about the average, for most of august and other months. the tickets are also available through other platforms eg. google flights but (imo) it's always better to book direct for a few reasons - easier to communicate with, less hassle, benefits in loyalty program etc.
hope this helps

after looked explanation,they told me,
because booked travels october, time restrictions, travel advise fco,
in case, travel essential (i'm travelling due business/work)
in case cover cancellations etc.
also cover medical emergencies long existing medical problem covid-19 related medical attention arises incase become positive return isolation costs relating accommodation due becoming positive return.

after speaking them, seems cancel battleface policy usual policy cover.
column5:
i have spoken to my usual bank travel insurance today.
after they have looked into my explanation,they have told me,
because i booked my travels in october, at that time there was no restrictions, and my travel is with the advise of fco,
in my case, if my travel is essential (i'm travelling due to business/work)
in that case it would cover me for cancellations etc.
also it would cover for any medical emergencies as long as its not existing medical problem also if covid-19 related medical attention arises incase i become positive on my return also if i have to isolation there and any costs relating to accommodation due to becoming positive on return.
although i have purchased battleface policy incase my bank didn't cover me.
after speaking to them, it seems like i can cancel battleface policy as my usual policy will cover.

column4:
personally - favoured etihad bc basis reasons, they're personal/specific (usually 'free' flights far deals quieter airport easier carry excess baggage prefer car models). understated, blingy, solid sexy.
as overall experience, emirates winner folk though. rounded levels e.g. lounge vs lounge, ife, wine list, cabin decor, service level etc. safe bet round i'd say, etihad announced plans midscale, cutback etc. add equation going via auh workaround far many carries risk, i'd easily emirates.
ek significantly cheaper, why. shame emirates brought premium economy time flying could comparisons interesting.
all comes priority canny lad - convenience, cost, experience, reassurance etc.
edited: 1:34 pm, february 18,
column5:
personally - i always favoured etihad bc on a like for like basis for a few reasons, although they're personal/specific (usually 'free' flights or far better deals or quieter airport or easier to carry excess baggage or prefer the car models). it's a bit more understated, not as blingy, more solid than sexy.
as an overall experience, emirates would be the winner for most folk though. it's just more rounded on more levels e.g. lounge vs lounge, ife, wine list, cabin decor, service level etc. safe bet all round i'd say, especially as etihad have announced plans to go more midscale, cutback etc. add into the equation going via auh is a workaround too far for many and carries a bit more risk, which is why i'd easily so go for emirates.
ek are significantly cheaper, but ask yourself why. it's a shame emirates won't have brought in premium economy by the time you're flying as that could make the comparisons very interesting.
all comes down to what your priority is though canny lad - convenience, cost, experience, reassurance etc.
edited: 1:34 pm, february 18, 2021

i *think* i'd - tied booking package - perhaps book room w/o hb/da ro b&b, basic room perhaps. way, that's 'bog standard' option easier compare/track across sales channels (websites/agents etc.) similarly, pruvo mentioned keep track price drops.
then far 'wriggle room' a) price drop - standard room available across places, thus chance drop - b) easier negotiate upsell check-in da package. believe me, gh able refuse option 'ancillary revenue' case missing group yours, given current economy.

column5:
@ clawit - if i recall, you're after half board right? so wouldn't gh direct not do a deal yet? thing is at least for gh, the vast majority of their da around options come via agents, so it's a captive market. i've seen them on bonvoy though for around the 200 gbp per night.
i *think* what i'd do - if you're not tied to booking a package that is - is perhaps book the room w/o the hb/da either ro or b&b, probably just the basic room only perhaps. this way, that's the 'bog standard' option and easier to compare/track across more sales channels (websites/agents etc.) similarly, you can also pruvo as mentioned before to keep track of price drops.
then you've far more 'wriggle room' to get a) a price drop - as the standard room will be available across more places, thus more chance to drop - and b) easier to negotiate an upsell even at check-in for the da package. believe me, even gh won't be able to refuse the option of 'ancillary revenue' if it's a case of missing out on a group like yours, especially given the current economy.
if any of them mention the expo word, ignore them.
going back to the anantara, did you look into if the discovery loyalty program offers were attractive for it? for about 50 usd, you could sign up to business travel subscription, get the program free and it offers discounts and benefits at select properties. worth a pop perhaps?

edited: 11:27 am, january 13, 2021

so i've been researching all day and even sent the indian embassy here in saudi if i needed a visa for this layover and i'm so stressed out already as i haven't received any feedback yet. anyone who could had the same experience who can help me out? i'd greatly appreciate it. thank you.

column8: My ticket says "You will leave the visa-free transit zone"

column4:
transiting bangkok possible following conditions: international international connection single ticket; less 12 hour layover.
kiwi.com cobs together separate tickets single itinerary, hence "self transfer" notation, unfortunately means qualify "single ticket". likewise 17 hour layover long, double go.
you need contact kiwi.com trying change it, aware, three tickets, means three airline change fees plus whatever kiwi.com charge changes.
spend little time reading air travel forum buy third party ticketing website.
column5:
transiting through bangkok is possible under the following conditions: international to international connection on a single ticket; less than 12 hour layover.
kiwi.com cobs together separate tickets into a single itinerary, hence the "self transfer" notation, so unfortunately that means you do not qualify under "single ticket". and likewise your 17 hour layover is too long, so a double no go.
you need to contact kiwi.com about trying to change it, but be aware, you probably have three tickets, that means three airline change fees plus whatever kiwi.com charge for changes.
spend a little time reading the air travel forum here before you buy from another third party ticketing website.
column8: My ticket says "You will leave the visa-free transit zone"

column4:
"my itinerary says 17 hours layover bangkok plan going airport."
tbh, can't see allowed board flight saudi arabia, entry requirements needed enter india thailand.
you plan enter country, flights single tickets cobbled together, choice matter. required thru immigration countries check next flight, means need required documents needed enter country...
sorry say, done research agents handed money too, kiwi (if not) complained shoddy third party ticket floggers trip advisor.
column5:
"my itinerary says that i have around 17 hours layover bangkok and i don't plan on going out the airport."
tbh, i can't even see you been allowed to board your flight in saudi arabia, as you do not have the entry requirements needed to enter both india or thailand.
you may not plan to enter the country, but since your flights are all single tickets cobbled together, you have no choice in the matter. you will be required to go thru immigration in both countries to check in for your next flight, which means you will need to have all the required documents needed to enter that country...
sorry to say, but you really should have done research on the agents you handed over your money too, and kiwi is one of (if not) the most complained about shoddy third party ticket floggers on trip advisor.
column8: My ticket says "You will leave the visa-free transit zone"

safe houses main areas. shelf tours exist could diy quite easily. metro running tied using cabs. inclined following:
jump metro ticket marina - good view city (its long thin) route marina (you'll see burj khalifa, burj al arab way down). could little wander newest part city - grab taxi jumeirah madinat wander jumeirah 'souk' - costa coffee good view burj al arab refreshment break.
walk al qasr hotel catch cab palace hotel - walk fountain (last show 11pm want catch it). see burj khalifa close personal. grab bite eat mall taxi airport.

column5:
safe as houses in the main areas. i don't think any off the shelf tours exist but you could diy it quite easily. metro will be running so you won't just be tied to using cabs. i might be inclined to do the following:
jump on the metro and get a ticket to the marina - you'll get a good view of the city (its long and thin) on route to the marina (you'll see the burj khalifa, burj al arab on the way down). you could have a little wander around the newest part of the city - then grab a taxi to jumeirah madinat and have a wander through the jumeirah 'souk' - costa coffee for a good view of the burj al arab and a refreshment break.
walk through to al qasr hotel to catch a cab to the palace hotel - walk around the fountain (last show is at 11pm i think so you may want to catch it). see the burj khalifa up close and personal. grab a bite to eat in the mall and then taxi back to the airport.
you'll need to allow an hour to get out of the airport and then whatever your airline suggests to get back in. if your flight is delayed, maybe just get the metro to mall of emirates and taxi to madinat (miss out the marina).
you'll need about 200 aed for metro/taxis/coffees/water. dinner on the card...
i know some dubai guides that could accompany you and arrange a car if you wanted something a little more vip.

my tip *always* situations put formal written request directors travel providers registered business address options are. trick write informed possible, coming across 'entitled' 'karen' things, let rights cma saying w.r.t. refunds. lot work, large part problems people situations face speaking customer-facing staff sales staff, many toeing company line.
only available options, opposed someone saying, decide do.
one main issues provider keeping funds lose flexibility choice, uplift prices. least cash hand, free choose book much.
regarding fcdo advice, *general* rule thumb, situation often airline cancel flight provider/agent cancel. there's situation last year, flights going despite government restrictions, travellers holiday 'blinking competition agents refund (some refund/agree day travel)
the government, least shappo, made rod lack clarity refund rights truth is, 'hit miss' provider adopt stance.
this important options table stands - favour terms tl fcdo advice - decide there.

column5:
well, nuance is your friend here. the traffic light system and the fcdo are two different things, think of the tl as more reflective of covid protection whereas the fcdo is *always* the more important measure, not least when it comes to things like insurance, if agents will refund, if airlines will cancel etc.
my tip *always* is in situations like this is to put a formal written request in to the directors of your travel providers at their registered business address and ask what your options are. the trick is to write is as informed as possible, without coming across as 'entitled' or 'karen' about things, but to let them know you know your rights and what the cma are saying especially w.r.t. refunds. this may seem a lot of work, but a large part of the problems people in these situations face is speaking to the customer-facing staff or sales staff, many of whom are just toeing the company line.
only then when you know what you know what your available options, as opposed to what someone may be saying, can you then decide what to do.
one of the main issues with a provider keeping your funds is you lose the flexibility of choice, especially if they uplift prices. at least with cash back in hand, you're free to choose who to book with and for how much.
regarding fcdo advice, as a *general* rule of thumb, if it's not with your situation that will often mean an airline will cancel a flight or a provider/agent may cancel. there's also the situation like last year, where some flights were still going but despite government restrictions, travellers shouldn't go on holiday and then it's a 'blinking competition with agents to get them to refund (some may even just refund/agree on day before travel)
the government, at least shappo, have made a rod for their own back with their lack of clarity about refund rights and the truth is, it will be 'hit and miss' and each provider will adopt their own stance.
this is why it's important to get your options on the table as it stands now - especially when it's in your favour in terms of tl and fcdo advice - and then you can decide from there.
in my own opinion, it's clear uk gov/shappo are doing whatever they can to discourage travel on the whole, and especially to dubai/uae (reputation management being the driver i feel) so it won't be clear for at least a couple of tl reviews (ie 6/7 jun then 3 weeks on) before we get any indication of the lie of the land.
from this forum alone, eh seemed to play hardball a lot over the pandemic - they weren't always upfront about t&c, for instance hiding them from their website at one time - and given the financial constraints of the group (likely needing another bailout) would suggest a refund would likely be slow. on the upside, they'll always be able to get you to dubai but the issue will likely be the cost. as for getting back, even if flights are still banned they'd just send you indirect, so you'll still get a holiday (if you decide you really want to go)
edited: 6:40 am, may 24, 2021

good luck.

column4: well lot time good idea average price trip. current prices influenced lack covid traveling. recently jump airfares family trip june. saw turkish airways business class promotion 3k rt short istanbul stop atlanta. consider save quite book separate ticket departure airport different airline whoever dubai carrier partners with. account leaving enough time recheck bags dubai departure city. personally focus emirates, qatar, turkish airways direct offer short connections cities route ie istanbul doha. etihad direct flights abu dhabi never checked price lower others. last trip took emirates ny turkish atlanta time much cheaper convenient. liked fact turkish using 787-9s new business class seating atl new york flying older 777er seating. hours extra ist shouldn’t problem due world class business class lounge pass time pay attention much connection times add long trip. something appears good pass up, wouldn’t, hopes something better.
column5: well you do have a lot of time to get a good idea what the average price will be for such a trip. current prices may be influenced by the lack of covid traveling. i recently did jump on some airfares for my family trip this june. i saw turkish airways had a business class promotion for a bit under 3k rt with a short istanbul stop out of atlanta. also consider it may save quite a bit to book a separate ticket to your us departure airport on a different airline than whoever your dubai carrier partners with. take into account leaving enough time to recheck your bags from dubai departure city. personally i would focus on emirates, qatar, and turkish airways as they are either direct from us or offer short connections in cities on route ie istanbul and doha. etihad also has direct flights to abu dhabi from us but i have never checked where their price was lower than the others. last trip we took emirates out of ny but turkish out of atlanta this time was much cheaper and a bit more convenient. also liked the fact turkish was using their 787-9s with their new business class seating out of atl while new york was flying the older 777er seating. a few hours extra in ist shouldn’t be a problem due to their world class business class lounge to pass the time but do pay attention to how much connection times add to the already long trip. all in all if something appears to good to pass up, i wouldn’t, in hopes of something a bit better.

column4:
late returning - sun shining uk, bike.
looks solved, sum way see it:
firstly away check in, doubt want risk this. assure nerve racking. flown thailand many times frequent flyer, silver status, usually quizzed return onward ticket (poot)' note, applied se asian regional travel, ex uk.
the proper option single entry tourist visa, pretty expensive uk. introduced call e-visa, not, e-application, post passport embassy london cardiff. malvern london £££, return secure posting £20ish. add £30 visa.
a common ruse buy cheap airticket. browse budget airline websites airasia find cheapest single within 30 days arrival - usually cambodia. buy this, show airline check throw away thailand. could expensive refundable ticket, refunds slow problematic.
i helps.
column5:
late in returning - sun shining in the uk, been out on my bike.
looks like it's been solved, but to sum it up and the way i see it:
firstly you may get away with it at check in, but i doubt you want to risk this. i can assure you it is a bit nerve racking. i have flown to thailand many times and even as a frequent flyer, silver status, etc i usually get quizzed re return or onward ticket (poot)' note, i did not say that this applied for se asian regional travel, but only ex uk.
the proper option is get a single entry tourist visa, but these are pretty expensive in the uk. they have introduced what they call an e-visa, but it is not, it is an e-application, you then take or post your passport to the embassy in london or cardiff. malvern to london is £££, return secure posting is £20ish. add this to the £30 visa.
a common ruse is to buy a cheap airticket. browse budget airline websites like airasia and find the cheapest single within 30 days of first arrival - usually to cambodia. buy this, show to airline at check in and then throw it away after you get to thailand. you could get a more expensive refundable ticket, but refunds can be slow and problematic.
i hope this helps.

your trip is long way off and i suggest wait till closer to the time and see what is required. currently it is unclear what will be required to enter the kingdom.pre covid they were looking at different visa and some proposed changes did no get approved.

column5:
the flight from the uk to istanbul in a narrowbody aircraft can be tiring. and you have to walk for miles in the new istanbul airport. at least the second leg to bangkok is long enough to sleep.
and it’s true, if something goes wrong, no one at tk cares. you forget something in the plane: consider it gone for good.
i agree it can be stressful to change planes in frankfurt. munich is much better. though at lh they do take care of you and your luggage in case of missed connections.
a stopover in dubai would be my last choice as both flights are too short to sleep and the waiting time in the middle of the night in dubai is dreadful.
as to in flight service i can only talk about business class:
turkish: very good, spacious but no partition to neighbor
lh: mediocre seats, too close for comfort
swiss would be a better alternative in times of covid (more privacy)
emirates: more privacy, actually similar to tg

column4:
people,
i spent weeks returned hk last month. learned lesson painful way regarding covid-19 test. why? took walgreens cvs tests 72 hr prior departure date/time printed airlines check staff. rejected test results can't proof results clia (cms) iso 15189 certificate. end, missed flight much trouble after..... long story short... painful experience making way back, including paying $275 airport test, rebooking quarantine hotel hk, rebooking flight, paying airport hotel room.
anyways, returned hk, 14 days quarantine hotel, found walgreens' test result lob name address printed. need google call lob. example, googled lab (lab corp)+ clia key words. following link

if google lab before, could save $2000 usd!
hope helps.
column5:
people,
i just spent 2 weeks in us and returned to hk last month. i learned the lesson a painful way regarding covid-19 test. why? i took both walgreens and cvs tests 72 hr prior to my departure date/time and printed them out for airlines check in staff. then they rejected my test results because i can't proof if these results do not have the clia (cms) nor iso 15189 certificate. at the end, i missed my flight and i had so much trouble after..... long story short... i had a very painful experience making my way back, including paying for $275 at airport for the test, rebooking quarantine hotel in hk, rebooking my flight, paying for airport hotel room.
anyways, after returned to hk, during these 14 days at quarantine hotel, i found out walgreens' test result has a lob name and address printed. what you need to do is to google or even call the lob. for example, i googled the lab (lab corp)+ clia as key words. i had the following link

if i had google this lab before, i could have save $2000 usd!
hope this helps.
column8: Does CVS COVID Test report have CLIA#?

column5: yes, i have flown business class from uk to bkk many times with swiss, lufthansa and austrian - all very good and well priced if you can get the cheapest fare bucket or a special offer. but flying via a european airport, especially in wintertime, adds an extra layer of risk. post covid19 i will be inclined to look at non stop flights - eva for me. more expensive yes, but less risky and less checking of documents, less security checks, quicker journey time too.

column4:
miami jfk busy airports esp international travelers flying large planes many passengers course immigration - different domestic flight humble opinion considering following points long journey.
1. direct expensive little risk delayed destination.
2. non direct easy pear shaped delay involved lots delays tons rescheduling going right next year , book today could easily change , need allow baggage transferred plane boarding gate next flight - distance travelling chaotic . need see flight delayed next due airline responsibility fall cost . ie new flight . im sure many fly day amsterdam .
are qatar flying dubai previously changed..
i never allow flying dubai jfk catch domestic - hour could hour vacate immigration landing , id instead journey look cheap stay local jfk - going hell distance dog tired running end prob catch last flight.
ive done tons flying states domestic v international different ball game .
column5:
both miami and jfk are very busy airports esp for international travelers and when flying large planes with many passengers and of course you have all the immigration to go through - very different to a us domestic flight so in my humble opinion i would be considering the following points for such a long journey.
1. direct is always more expensive because their is such little risk and even if delayed you will still get to your destination.
2. non direct is very easy to go pear shaped if any delay is involved and their are lots of delays and tons of rescheduling going on right now until next year , so what you book today could very easily change , you will need to allow baggage to be transferred from one plane to another and then get to the boarding gate for the next flight - for me for the distance you are travelling that would be to chaotic . also you need to see if a flight is delayed when is the next one due out and is it the airline responsibility or would it fall to you to cost it . ie a new flight . im not sure how many fly each day maybe only one from amsterdam .
are qatar now flying into dubai as they were not previously although i think that may have changed..
i would never allow flying from dubai to jfk to then catch a domestic - 1 hour it could take a hour to vacate go through immigration from landing , id instead for that journey look at a cheap stay local to jfk - your going one hell of a distance and you will be dog tired to then be running around at the end to prob not catch that very last flight.
ive done tons of flying in the states and domestic v international very different ball game .
column8: First trip to Dubai in 2022, flying questions.

column4:
it’s personal preference. flying premium business overnight flight isn’t bad gain day advantageous return journey home earlier economy you’ll next sleep nodding dog following afternoon
personally several choices flight available night flight significantly cheaper there’s little difference price i’d afternoon flight you’ll proper nights sleep ready start holiday.
edited: 6:07 am, january 05,
column5:
it’s personal preference. if flying premium or business then an overnight flight isn’t bad as you can gain a day and this can be advantageous on the return journey also as you get home earlier however if in economy you’ll get next to no sleep and will be like a nodding dog the following afternoon
personally if you have several choices of flight available and the night flight is significantly cheaper then go for it but if there’s little difference in price i’d do the afternoon flight and you’ll get a proper nights sleep ready to start your holiday.
edited: 6:07 am, january 05, 2021

column4:
i'm curious crazy people planning following trip 2022. received dose pfizer vaccine btw, fully vaccinated.
i bunch alaska airlines miles, dream consider greatest air award redemptions available: 70k alaska miles fly cathay class usa hong kong, stopover long want, continue business class south africa.
what i'm planning flying usa hk early march, transiting immediately cathay flight taiwan meet friends. allowed current rules cathay flights separate tickets. time taiwan philippines, plan fly hong kong, spend days there, flight south africa.
i booked hk taiwan flight. i'm planning booking usa-hk-south africa flights next couple months. philippines wait figure dodgy (in terms hong kong letting in).
what guys think? crazy? cost couple hundred us$s undo awards, huge financial penalty can't it. friends flights booked taiwan, nonstop usa via eva. i'd scramble figure there. again, taiwan open tourists right knows lol.
column5:
i'm curious how crazy people think i am for planning the following trip for 2022. i have received my first dose of the pfizer vaccine btw, so will be fully vaccinated.
i have a bunch of alaska airlines miles, and it's been a dream of mine to use some for what i consider one of the greatest air award redemptions available: 70k alaska miles to fly cathay first class from the usa to hong kong, stopover as long as i want, and then continue on in business class to south africa.
what i'm planning on doing is flying from the usa to hk in early march, and then transiting immediately to another cathay flight to taiwan where i will meet some friends. this is not allowed under current rules since the cathay flights would be on separate tickets. then after some time in taiwan and the philippines, i plan to fly back to hong kong, spend a few days there, and then take my flight to south africa.
i already have booked the hk to taiwan flight. i'm planning on booking the usa-hk-south africa flights in the next couple of months. the philippines stuff i can wait on as i figure it is the most dodgy (in terms of hong kong letting me in).
what do you guys think? am i crazy? it would only cost me a couple hundred us$s to undo the awards, so no huge financial penalty if i can't make it. but my friends already have their flights booked to taiwan, nonstop from usa via eva. so i'd have to scramble to figure out how to get there. then again, taiwan isn't open for tourists right now either so who knows lol.
