column4:
me,the price plane ticket difference financially secure not.
so ethiad offered full refund choice rebook future increase fare ethiad credit,that’s chose knew return soon option became available me.
if helped keep airlines afloat taking option pulling money out,then considered happy individual choice.
i haven’t tied money hotels payable upon arrival.
you run risk difficulties dealing agents haven’t booked directly airline,but that’s individual choice book.
we could round round defending individual choices,as right wrong answer,as long happy, way decided best way forward personally is,then that’s matters.
tracy
column5:
for me,the price of a plane ticket is not the difference between me being financially secure or not.
so when ethiad offered a full refund or the choice to rebook in the future with no increase in fare and some ethiad credit,that’s what i chose because i knew i would return as soon as the option became available to me.
if it helped to keep airlines afloat by taking that option and not pulling my money out,then i also considered that and was happy with my individual choice.
i haven’t tied any money up in hotels because they are all payable upon arrival.
you always run the risk of having difficulties dealing with agents when you haven’t booked directly with the airline,but again that’s our individual choice of how we book.
we could go round and round defending our individual choices,as i say no right or wrong answer,as long as we are all happy, with the way we have all decided on the best way forward for us personally is,then that’s all that matters.
tracy x

column4:
"any thoughts appreciated"
i can't see getting refund flights unless booked expensive fully refundable tickets singapore airlines flying bangkok everyday, choice want go, every right refund.
but saying that, depending booked flights, lowest priced tickets option free change flight date (but fare difference applicable) option available said booked flights whilst offer happening (which least last months longer).
column5:
"any thoughts on this would be appreciated"
i can't see you getting a refund for your flights unless you booked very expensive fully refundable tickets as singapore airlines are still flying into bangkok everyday, and since it's your choice not to want to go, then they have every right not to refund.
but in saying that, depending on when you booked your flights, even the lowest priced tickets have the option of a free change in flight date (but fare difference is applicable) so that option should be available to you if like i said you booked your flights whilst this offer was happening (which it has been for at least the last 4 months or longer).

the flight carried 130 german tourists landed phuket international airport, 16 german travellers got plane. remaining tourists flew suvarnabhumi airport bangkok entered state quarantine process. next flight 7."

edited: 12:20 pm, april 04,
column5:
"#96......how many non thais were on the flight?"
"on saturday, thai airway's first flight from germany's frankfurt -- flight tg921 -- touched down at phuket airport, the first since an international travel lockdown started early last year when the pandemic broke out.
the flight carried 130 german tourists and first landed at phuket international airport, where 16 german travellers got off the plane. the remaining tourists then flew to suvarnabhumi airport in bangkok and entered the state quarantine process. the next flight will be on may 7."

edited: 12:20 pm, april 04, 2021

column5:
hi. i think i may have been overly optimistic when i bought tickets last fall to fly to scotland at the end of may. however, even if i don’t make it to scotland in 2021, i will make it there sometime, so i am continuing with my planning. we will have 15 nights/14 days. we will begin in edinburgh and leave from inverness. here is my rough itinerary. day 0 is our arrival day.
day 1 and 2: stay in edinburgh and explore
day 3: rent a car and see the kelpies, stirling castle, and drive towards glencoe - unsure where to stay
day 4: explore glencoe, go to eilann donan castle, stay in portree
day 5,6, and 7: explore the isle of skye
day 8: ferry to lewis and harris
day 9, 10: explore lewis and harris
day 11, 12: ferry to ullapool, take the applecross/torridon drive - unsure where to stay the night for day 11, will be in inverness by the end of day 12
day 13, 14: inverness, hopeman ( where my husband’s ancestors are from), culloden
i’m not sure the best way to arrange to see the isle of skye, lewis and harris, and fit in the applecross/torridon drive, so i am open to suggestions. and any other suggestions on routes, where to stay, what to see. thank you.

column4:
kindly avoid pcr travel test certificate service provided atruchecks collaboration eurofins:
i purchased covid test website (  ) fulfill requirement flight etihad airline 12th january. website see advertises partner etihad shows compatibility flights etihad.
the website designed way pay test allowed apply appointment. trusted official partners etihad airline went ahead paid test reached appointment booking page, find appropriate timing working hours worked flight. hence, decided reach booking appointment advice. much surprise responded test compatible flight change flight day able avail service company.
disappointed response asked refund company completely refused return money stating non-refundable service. booked appointment agree refund, offered waive 25 gbp required change test date useless booked test date yet.
this seems complete violation consumer rights.
column5:
kindly avoid the pcr travel test certificate service provided by atruchecks in collaboration with eurofins:
i purchased a covid test on the website (  ) to fulfill the requirement of my flight with etihad airline on 12th of january. the website as you can see advertises itself as a partner of etihad and shows compatibility with all flights of etihad.
the website is designed in a way that you pay for the test and only then you are allowed to apply for an appointment. i trusted that they are official partners of etihad airline so went ahead and paid for the test with them but when i reached appointment booking page, i couldn't find an appropriate timing during their working hours that worked for my flight. hence, i decided to reach out to them before booking the appointment and ask for advice. much to my surprise they responded that the test would not be compatible with my flight and i should change my flight to another day to be able to avail the service from their company.
disappointed by the response i asked for a refund where the company completely refused to return my money stating it is a non-refundable service. i had not even booked for an appointment yet and still they would not agree to refund, they only offered to waive off the 25 gbp required to change the test date but that is useless for me as i have not booked a test date yet.
this seems to be a complete violation of my consumer rights.

column4:
mangomunky - advice! we're super safe - worth risking it. we're hoping indonesia opens next spring/summer tourism industry survives. :( tips flexible domestic flights - i'm 'go flow' travel type, trip planning gives something dream look forward home! feel inclined accommodations lined advance specifically honeymoon - trip i'd less concerned planning fly :) good last minute changes itinerary issue decide change little!
if understand correctly, recommend bali, central java, gili meno (time permitting) order bali, west/central flores, gili (time permitting) order? so, internationally, flying bali lombok? international flights expect we'll want book well advance, knowing we're starting ending trip critical.
it sounds java interesting different perspective culture. what, opinion, interests/reasons visiting western central flores (beyond seeing komodos, course!)?
thanks insight!! can't wait explore.
column5:
mangomunky - thank you for the great advice! we're being super safe - not worth risking it. we're just hoping that indonesia opens back up by next spring/summer and that their tourism industry survives. :( great tips on flexible domestic flights - i'm actually more of a 'go with the flow' travel type, but trip planning gives me something to dream about and look forward to from home! i also feel a bit more inclined to have accommodations lined up in advance specifically for a honeymoon - any other trip i'd be less concerned about planning on the fly :) it's really good to know that last minute changes to the itinerary won't be an issue though if we decide to change things up a little!
if i understand you correctly, you recommend either bali, central java, and then gili meno (time permitting) in that order or bali, west/central flores, and then gili (time permitting) in that order? so, internationally, flying into bali and out of lombok? it's the international flights that i expect we'll want to book well in advance, so knowing where we're starting and ending the trip is more critical.
it sounds like java would be interesting for a different perspective and culture. what, in your own opinion, would be the interests/reasons for visiting western and central flores (beyond seeing the komodos, of course!)?
thanks again for your great insight!! we really can't wait to go and explore.

column4:
following annemieke airline treat you. various panics germany shutting countries lufthansa misinterpreted countries rules. uk put red list last xmas lufthansa misinterpreted german rules letting german passport holders uk - germany flights regardless whether german residents not. usa citizens. son eclectic mix employees. munich residents. uk employee refused boarding manchester wasn’t german. employee refused barding chicago wasn’t german. son ring foreign office contact lufthansa flights.
and then, don’t live, resident asia/australia require least flight change. country change flights restrictions transit. singapore imposed last year “europeans”.
and mistake booking separate tickets (to save money) able connection flight. guarantee chosen airline transfer desk airside. means “arrive”, passport control , collect bags, customs re-checkin. permitted transfer enter country (because covid rules) next flight“.
singapore prime example. often singapore airlines muc dps. ordinarily (pre-covid) could “arrive” singapore (we require visas) wished. often went “down town” long layover (8hrs so). currently permitted arrive.
even pre-covid number indian nationals made mistake booking separate tickets singapore require arrive next flight. indian nationals require visa enter singapore.
so bali opening means little unless dot i’s cross t’s regulations countries airlines.
column5:
and following on from annemieke you also do not know how the airline will treat you. in the various panics that germany has had in shutting down countries lufthansa has misinterpreted their own countries rules. when uk was put on the red list last xmas lufthansa misinterpreted german rules and were only letting german passport holders on their uk - germany flights regardless of whether they were german residents or not. same for usa citizens. my son has an eclectic mix of employees. all munich residents. he had a uk employee who was refused boarding in manchester because he wasn’t german. he had a us employee who was refused barding in chicago because he wasn’t german. my son had to ring the foreign office to get them to contact lufthansa to get them on their flights.
and then, again we don’t know where you are from or live, for most of us not resident in asia/australia we require at least one flight change. the country where you change flights might have restrictions for you even in transit. singapore imposed this last year for all “europeans”.
and if you make the mistake of booking separate tickets (to save money) you might not be able to make your connection flight. this is because there is no guarantee your chosen airline has a transfer desk airside. this means you have to “arrive”, go through passport control , collect your bags, go through customs and re-checkin. so although you may be permitted to transfer but not enter the country (because of covid rules) then you can not make your next flight“.
singapore again is a prime example. we often use singapore airlines muc to dps. ordinarily (pre-covid) we could “arrive” in singapore (we require no visas) if we wished. we often went “down town” if we had a long layover (8hrs or so). currently not permitted to arrive.
even pre-covid a number of indian nationals have made the mistake of booking separate tickets over singapore which would require them to arrive to get the next flight. indian nationals require a visa to enter singapore.
so bali opening means little unless you can dot the i’s and cross the t’s of all the regulations from all the countries and all the airlines.

column4:
often air travel people tend flight hours, international trips generally least hours altogether factor movements - checking hotel, getting airport (at least hours flight time), flight, getting next hotel, early able check yet... lose best part day. europe often switch cities train sleep way.
even domestic flights, lose fair chunk time. want places thailand malaysia, plus international locations week trip... lot time wasted transit. rule thumb experience se asia city days maximum.
also personally, wanting relax beach location, opinion need nights minimum, relaxation benefit.
just opinion .. i'd penang malaysia days, bangkok days, chiang mai days rest beach location.
column5:
often with air travel people tend to think of the flight itself which might be 1 or 2 hours, but with international trips it will generally take at least 6 hours altogether when you factor in all the movements - checking out of hotel, getting to airport (at least 2 hours before flight time), then the flight, then getting to the next hotel, and if too early you might not be able to check in yet... so really you lose the best part of a day. it's not like europe where you can often switch cities by train and sleep on the way.
even domestic flights, you lose a fair chunk of time. so if you want to go to 3 places in thailand and 2 in malaysia, plus 2 international locations in a 3 week trip... it's a lot of time wasted in transit. my own rule of thumb from my experience in se asia is 1 city each 5 days maximum.
also personally, if wanting to relax at a beach location, in my opinion you need 6 or 7 nights minimum, to really get the relaxation benefit.
just my own opinion .. i'd go to penang in malaysia for about 4 days, then bangkok 3 days, chiang mai 5 days then the rest at a beach location.
